questions.question_text: An electric car company hires an IT consulting company to improve the cybersecurity of its vehicles. Which of the following should achieve the BEST long-term result for the company?

discussion.content:
Maybe: B. Reviewing proposed designs and prototypes for cybersecurity vulnerabilities ?
I think CompTIA might want you to know that the earlier security is designed into a product, the more robustly secure the product can be. Instead of trying to patch up, and work around, an insecure design; you can have security implemented correctly, right from the beginning. The product will be designed from the start with security in mind.
The question is asking for "the BEST **long-term** result."
If a car is in production, there might not be much you do. 
If you were to go further back: D. Reviewing and influencing requirements for an early development vehicle 
You might do better you at catching mistakes earlier, and fix the mistakes before production.
But if you go all the way back to B. The vehicle can be designed, right from the beginning, in the most secure manner.
it needs to address production vehicles so the company's reputation isnt damaged

comments.content: I think production vehicles just means vehicles that have are now on the market for purchase. So, the best time to improve cybersecurity is after the car is done and customers are purchasing? Is that because they can just improve on the next model?

choices.C: Performing a cyber risk assessment on production vehicles
choices.A: Designing and developing add-on security components for fielded vehicles
choices.B: Reviewing proposed designs and prototypes for cybersecurity vulnerabilities
choices.D: Reviewing and influencing requirements for an early development vehicle

questions.question_text: A security manager is determining the best DLP solution for an enterprise. A list of requirements was created to use during the source selection. The security manager wants to confirm a solution exists for the requirements that have been defined. Which of the following should the security manager use?

discussion.content: Request for Information (RFI) - "The RFI is issued by organizations seeking information regarding SPECIFIC products or services in the marketplace that could be used to fill a SPECIFIC need" (pg 62, CASP+ All-in-One by Nick Lane)
its RFP, because like D1960 said, an RFI only applies when the other variables(reqs)are unknown.
wtf is this dumb ass question even asking?

comments.content: Also from the question: "A security manager is determining the best DLP." Clearly there is an understanding of the marketplace the company is about to enter.

discussion.content:
Maybe: B. RFP ?
From the question: "A list of requirements was created . . ."
From the article: RFI, RFQ, & RFP: What’s the Difference?
> "the RFI is really a preliminary document used by companies that don’t understand the marketplace they’re about to enter"
> "An RFP, “Request for Proposal,” is a document that asks vendors to propose solutions to a customer’s problems or business requirements."
This business has a specific list of requirements.

✑ The domain controller IP is 192.168.100.1.
✑ The client machine IP is 192.168.200.37.
Which of the following should be used to confirm this is the only open port on the web server?

questions.question_text:
A company is purchasing an application that will be used to manage all IT assets as well as provide an incident and problem management solution for IT activity.
The company narrows the search to two products, Application A and Application B, which meet all of its requirements. Application A is the most cost-effective product, but it is also the riskiest, so the company purchases Application B. Which of the following types of strategies did the company use when determining risk appetite?

comments.content:
Negative ghost rider! C. Risk avoidance 
adjusting the project plan so that the conditions triggering a risk event are no longer present and the risk is eliminated.

discussion.content: The answer should be A. Risk avoidance is when you eliminate the risk. In this case the risk is present and can be mitigated by Application B
Agree with the given answer C. They are avoiding the risk brought on by App A by going with App B.
